article: At first I couldn't believe it! There were no _ in rows; no bells rang; no one had to go to _ . Although we all lived "in" _ made us go to bed at a certain time; there was no "lights out". The _ thing was that practically all the students went to class, _ very few people stayed up late at night. Only the new people stayed up or _ class. The new ones always went wild _ ,but this never lasted long. The _ took some getting used to. Our teachers treated us like _ ;never did we have to _ "stand up", "speak out". I don't _ one student who didn't try his best. The subjects were the same as those in _ school, but what difference in the approach ! For example, in botany we had _ classes in the spring or fall, but instead we _ two gardens, a vegetable garden and a flower garden. _ in winter we each studied a few _ things about what we had grown. In math the students built three different kinds of storeroom--small ones _ ,but usable. They did this instead of having lessons in the classroom. They really had a _ time too, designing everything, drawing the blueprints, _ the angles and so on. I didn't take _ I can't stand it! Besides, I could do the basic things with numbers. That's _ ! _ I think I am a _ person for having gone to the school. I can read and write as well as anyone else my age, and I can think better. That's probably a real big _ between the free school and regular school--the amount of _ .
